content.raw:
This appears to prefix the world name to the scoped name. Considering this in the context of #1199 (in which scoped names are going to be required for `Model::GetJoint`), this will put an additional burden on the users of the API. For example, consider a model with an embedded plugin (ie. [pioneer2dx with DiffDrivePlugin](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/default/pioneer2dx/model.sdf#cl-175)). The model can be inserted into worlds with different names. The plugin will have to be modified to get the current world name when constructing the scoped name of the joint to get.

That is a tractable problem, but it does increase the complexity of using the API.
content.html:
This appears to prefix the world name to the scoped name. Considering this in the context of #1199 (in which scoped names are going to be required for Model::GetJoint), this will put an additional burden on the users of the API. For example, consider a model with an embedded plugin (ie. pioneer2dx with DiffDrivePlugin). The model can be inserted into worlds with different names. The plugin will have to be modified to get the current world name when constructing the scoped name of the joint to get.

That is a tractable problem, but it does increase the complexity of using the API.

content.raw: Yup, requiring the name of the world is more complicated, but it's also necessary to support multiple worlds on a single server.
content.html: Yup, requiring the name of the world is more complicated, but it's also necessary to support multiple worlds on a single server.

content.raw: Ok, can we include a modification to DiffDrivePlugin in this pull request that will use the full scoped name? It will just be an example of how to properly set up scoped names. I'll work on a patch.
content.html: Ok, can we include a modification to DiffDrivePlugin in this pull request that will use the full scoped name? It will just be an example of how to properly set up scoped names. I'll work on a patch.

content.raw: I believe we should just remove the comment and warning message in Model.cc on the default branch.
content.html: I believe we should just remove the comment and warning message in Model.cc on the default branch.

content.raw:
Many tests are failing, looks like mostly from not being able to verify an entity has spawned or not.  

Although there's no ABI/API breakages, the change could break users code. Maybe we should release it in 4.0 and mention it in the migration guide?

Although there's no ABI/API breakages, the change could break users code. Maybe we should release it in 4.0 and mention it in the migration guide?

content.raw:
Here's an example test failure:
~~~
101: [ RUN      ] ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.CreateForceTorque
101: [Msg] Waiting for master.
101: [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
101: [Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.189
101: [Wrn] [ModelDatabase.cc:344] Getting models from[http://gazebosim.org/models/]. This may take a few seconds.
101: [Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:144] ServerFixture load in 25.3 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
101: Warning [parser.cc:396] Converting a deprecated SDF source[data-string].
101: [Err] [ForceTorqueSensor.cc:69] Parent of a force torque sensor[force_torque] Must be a joint
101: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/gazebo/gazebo/sensors/ForceTorqueSensor_TEST.cc:56: Failure
101: Value of: std::string("default::pioneer2dx::left_wheel_hinge::force_torque")
101:   Actual: "default::pioneer2dx::left_wheel_hinge::force_torque"
101: Expected: sensorName
101: Which is: "pioneer2dx::left_wheel_hinge::force_torque"
101: UNIT_ForceTorqueSensor_TEST: /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:418: T* boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::physics::Joint]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
101/132 Test #101: UNIT_ForceTorqueSensor_TEST ............***Exception: Other 34.01 sec
~~~
The sensor name doesn't match the expected value, and it also seg-faults.

content.raw:
I just had a random thought:

For c++ namespaces, you can prepend `::` to declare that it is the start of a namespace (ie. `::gazebo::physics::Model`), perhaps we could use that syntax as well? If a world name is to be prepended, then prepend a `::` as well:
~~~
model_1::model_2::...::model_N::link::collision
vs
::world::model_1::model_2::...::model_N::link::collision
~~~
We could use the initial `::` as a signifier that the world is included, otherwise it assumes a model name and whatever world is returned by `physics::get_world()`.
content.html:
I just had a random thought:

For c++ namespaces, you can prepend :: to declare that it is the start of a namespace (ie. ::gazebo::physics::Model), perhaps we could use that syntax as well? If a world name is to be prepended, then prepend a :: as well:

model_1::model_2::...::model_N::link::collision
vs
::world::model_1::model_2::...::model_N::link::collision

We could use the initial :: as a signifier that the world is included, otherwise it assumes a model name and whatever world is returned by physics::get_world().
